author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration is awarding a total of $2.7 billion to three companies to support uranium enrichment for nuclear energy. American Centrifuge Operating, General Matter and Orano Federal Services will receive $900 million each. General Matter is reportedly backed by billionaire Peter Thiel. The Trump administration said that the funding will help the U.S. transition away from...
title: Trump administration announces $2.7 billion to bolster nuclear energy

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) hammered President Trump on Monday for this weekend's U.S. attack on Venezuela, saying the raid was an “unprecedented” exercise lacking both a legal authorization and a practical justification. Speaking to reporters in the Capitol, Jeffries said the Jan. 2 incursion, which led to the capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás...
title: Jeffries blasts Trump’s Venezuela attack as ‘unprecedented’ fight to reward oil companies

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: President Trump’s toppling of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro has left a cloud of uncertainty across the region as the president issued threats against other Latin American leaders and pledged the U.S. will be “in charge” of Venezuela. After an early Saturday morning raid that led to the capture of Maduro, Trump over the weekend levied...
title: After Venezuela, Trump dials up pressure on Latin American leaders

author: Julia Shapero
description: {beacon} Technology Technology   The Big Story  Palantir courts contracts, controversy in Trump 2.0 Palantir has seen its portfolio of government contracts mushroom in President Trump’s second term, but the company is also facing growing scrutiny over its work with the administration, particularly its assistance with controversial immigration efforts. © J. Scott Applewhite, Associated Press...
title: Palantir sees growth under Trump

author: Joseph Choi
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.), who cast a critical vote to confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as secretary of the Health and Human Services Department, on Monday blasted the reduction of the childhood immunization schedule by Kennedy and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC announced Monday it would be reducing the number...
title: Cassidy rips RFK Jr. vaccine schedule change, says it's 'based on no scientific input'

author: Alix Martichoux
description: The U.S. is changing which vaccines are recommended for children, slashing the number of shots endorsed for everyone and leaving more decisions in the hands of parents and pediatricians.
title: New CDC vaccine guidelines: These shots are no longer recommended for all children

author: Max Rego
description: The State Department on Monday echoed President Trump’s rhetoric on U.S. authority in the Western Hemisphere. “This is OUR Hemisphere, and President Trump will not allow our security to be threatened,” the department wrote on the social platform X.  After U.S. forces captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, Trump told reporters...
title: State Department asserts 'this is our hemisphere,' magnifying Trump's 'Don-roe' Doctrine

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz’s (D) stunning decision to drop his reelection bid is raising speculation that Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) may run for the seat, thrilling members of her party at a time when they find themselves ensnared in a growing political scandal over widespread fraud. The New York Times reported that Walz and Klobuchar met...
title: Democrats thrilled by prospect of Klobuchar running to replace Walz

author: Tara Suter
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) on Monday went after Hilton Hotels, accusing it of engaging in an effort to cancel agents' reservations in Minnesota. The company denied the claim. “@HiltonHotels has launched a coordinated campaign in Minneapolis to REFUSE service to DHS law enforcement,” DHS said in a post on the social platform X. ...
title: DHS blasts Hilton Hotels for 'coordinated campaign' to cancel agents' reservations

author: Max Rego
description: In the wake of U.S. forces capturing Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro on Saturday, his vice president, Delcy Rodríguez, has taken over the South American country. Rodríguez, a longtime Maduro ally, led her first council of ministers meeting as acting president on Sunday. The 56-year-old said in an address to Venezuelans on Saturday — after Maduro...
title: Who is Delcy Rodríguez, interim Venezuela president?

description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) will hold a news conference late Monday afternoon. His remarks come as Congress returns to Washington following the holiday recess and as lawmakers press for details on the U.S. raid over the weekend that captured Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro. Trump said that the U.S. would “run” the South American...
title: Watch live: Jeffries news conference

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) will no longer be requiring states to report childhood and adolescent immunization statuses as it explores "alternative immunization measures." In a Dec. 30 memo to states, CMS Deputy Administrator Dan Brillman said his agency would be removing four measures from its Core Sets, standardized health care measurements...
title: CMS no longer requiring childhood vaccination data from states

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump told reporters aboard Air Force One late Sunday the court case against captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is “infallible.” “We're just going to go through a slog of a trial. A judge is very respected, [U.S. District Judge Alvin Hellerstein] is a highly respected judge. We'll see how we do. The case is,...
title: Trump: Case against Maduro 'infallible'

author: Rachel Frazin
description: A government funding bill released Monday excludes a controversial pesticides provision, marking a win for the Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) movement for at least the time being. The provision in question is a wonky one: It would seek to prevent pesticides from carrying warnings on their label of health effects beyond those recognized by the Environmental...
title: Funding bill excludes controversial pesticide provision hated by MAHA

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is reducing the number of vaccines it recommends for children, officials said Monday, a major shift that officials say will bring the U.S. recommendations more similar to those of other developed countries.   The move, which is effective immediately, fulfills a longtime goal of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and...
title: RFK Jr., CDC, in seismic shift, reduce number of recommended vaccines for children

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) lauded Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) as a “true public servant” in a statement on Monday amid speculation that she may run for his seat after Walz announced he would be dropping his bid for a third term. “Governor Walz made the difficult decision to focus on his job and the...
title: Klobuchar calls Walz 'true public servant' amid speculation she will run to succeed him

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Mario Díaz-Balart (R-Fla.) lashed out at a reporter who asked why he wasn’t supporting Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado to serve as interim leader of the Latin American country after the Trump administration ousted President Nicolás Maduro from power. Díaz-Balart interrupted the reporter before he could finish asking his question and reprimanded him....
title: Florida Republican erupts at reporter asking if he abandoned Machado

author: Alix Martichoux
description: New data released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Monday shows a massive spike in flu activity nationwide.
title: 30 states are in CDC's worst tier for flu as 'super' variant spreads

description: Let’s be clear about who’s getting hit the hardest: the so-called “missing middle,” who are doing everything “right” and still getting squeezed.
title: Dems jump on health care messaging amid disastrous premium spike

author: Ella Lee
description: Nicolás Maduro, the former Venezuelan president whom U.S. forces toppled, struck a defiant tone Monday as he doubled down in self-defense while pleading not guilty to federal drug trafficking charges.  “I was captured,” Maduro said in Spanish, according to a courtroom reporter’s translation before he was cut off by the judge, the Associated Press reported.   Later asked to enter his...
title: Maduro strikes defiant tone as he professes innocence in court

author: Cate Martel
description: In today's issue: Maduro’s first court appearance in N.Y., Venezuela briefing on Capitol Hill, Trump eyes Colombia and Cuba, Hegseth moves to demote Sen. Mark Kelly, Tim Walz drops reelection bid.

description: Some trends and patterns are potential guides on this journey.

author: The Hill staff
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) will answer reporters' questions at a Monday news conference after dropping his reelection bid. Walz, who was former Vice President Kamala Harris's 2024 running mate, was facing a challenging political future after finding himself at the epicenter of a growing fraud scandal focused on hundreds of millions of dollars allegedly...
title: Watch live: Walz holds news conference after dropping reelection bid

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum rebuffed last week's U.S. military action in Venezuela and reaffirmed her country’s sovereignty, pushing back against President Trump’s veiled threats of intervention. “We categorically reject intervention in the internal affairs of other countries. The history of Latin America is clear and compelling: intervention has never brought democracy, never generated well-being, nor...
title: Sheinbaum rebuffs Trump's Venezuela operation, threats to Mexico

author: Steven Lubet, opinion contributor
description: The ratifiers of the 14th Amendment could not have contemplated excluding the children of unlawful entrants, because the concept did not yet exist in 1868.
title: The dog that didn’t bark on birthright citizenship

author: Addy Bink
description: Check your change: Newly-designed coins celebrating the nation's semiquincentennial (aka, its 250th anniversary) are entering circulation today.
title: New coins honoring nation's 250th anniversary entering circulation: What they look like

author: Derrick Johnson, opinion contributor
description: Big Tech is building sprawling AI data centers in our backyards, and they’re making you pay for it.
title: The cost of AI is being dumped on you

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump on Sunday said he spoke to oil companies ahead of the operation in Venezuela and claimed they’re eager to revitalize the industry in the South American nation. Reporters on Air Force One asked the president if he spoke to American oil companies, tipping them off before U.S. forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro...
title: Trump says he tipped off oil companies on Venezuela attack

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump on Sunday took aim at Cuba after the U.S.’s recent capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. “You know, one of the things that is happening, and I think you see it, you see it all the time, Howard. You’ve seen it — that Cuba is ready to fall,” Trump said on Air Force...
title: Trump: Cuba 'ready to fall'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Greenland Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen shot back at President Trump’s renewed threats to take over the self-governing, resource-rich territory, which is part of Denmark, a day after U.S. forces ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro from power. The prime minister touted the long-standing alliance between America and Greenland, saying in a post on Facebook, “We have...
title: Greenland prime minister on Trump takeover threats: 'No more fantasies'

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has warned that 2026 will be a difficult year. It appears she is correct with the U.S. government shutdown threat and the potential for increased political turmoil due to Trump's divisive politics and the high rate of Congressional retirements.
title: Several political storms loom on the horizon in 2026

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) announced on Monday that he was dropping his reelection bid for a third term as scrutiny grows over his handling of a massive fraud scandal in his state. “Every minute I spend defending my own political interests would be a minute I can’t spend defending the people of Minnesota against...
title: Walz won't seek reelection amid growing scrutiny over fraud scandal

author: Tara Suter
description: Delcy Rodríguez, the acting president of Venezuela following the U.S. capture and arrest of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, on Sunday offered a conciliatory message to the United States and President Trump. Rodriguez invited the U.S. to collaborate with her government in strengthen "coexistence," just a day after she had struck a defiant tone by saying...
title: Venezuela's Delcy Rodríguez sends conciliatory message to Trump, US

author: Austin Sarat, opinion contributor
description: Promises not to raise taxes have put this country in a horrible bind.
title: Can Mamdani find the answer to America's public investment crisis?

author: The Hill Staff
description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will make his first court appearance Monday, after the Trump administration indicted and captured the South American leader over the weekend. President Trump on Sunday night made it clear when asked by reporters who is running Venezuela: "We're in charge." Maduro and his wife, who were transported on Monday morning to...
title: Live updates: Trump asserts US control in Venezuela as Maduro heads to court; Congress returns

author: William Becker, opinion contributor
description: Twenty-five years ago, Gallup began asking Americans if they were proud of their country. Nine out of 10 said yes, they were extremely or very proud of the United States. Things have changed. National pride has sunk to 58 percent, an all-time low. The response among young people is especially telling. Gallup found that the...
title: We need a program of national service

author: The Associated Press
description: A small, private plane crashed at the Provincetown Municipal Airport on Cape Cod on Sunday afternoon, catching fire and killing the pilot.
title: Small plane crash at Cape Cod airport leaves pilot dead

author: Tara Suter
description: Captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro was en route to a New York courthouse early Monday for his first court appearance in the U.S. after being captured. Maduro, who could face life in prison if convicted on narco-terrorism charges, and his wife are expected to appear in court at noon EST. The former Venezuelan leader and...
title: Venezuela's Maduro set for first court appearance after US capture

author: The Associated Press
description: Auschwitz survivor Eva Schloss, the stepsister of teenage diarist Anne Frank and a tireless educator about the horrors of the Holocaust, has died.
title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96

author: Jared Gans
description: Uncertainty surrounds Trump's claim that the US is 'in charge' of Venezuela following Maduro's capture.
title: 'We're in charge': Trump's vow to 'run' Venezuela prompts questions
